title: Kadai Chole/ Chana Masala || Punjabi Style
content:
North Indian Style Recipe: Chole Masala Servings: 4 Duration: 20 mins Chana is a type of chickpea/Bean, mostly used in Asian countries. It's easily available in grocery stores/ Indian stores. Chole Bhatura is very famous and even green combination in Punjab, India . It's breakfast recipe which is available in Indian restaurants.Bhatura is made up of maida (soft wheat) It's nutrition facts are zero cholesterol, vitamin B6, iron and magnesium Today, I prepared chole masala with spices, onion, tomatoes and lemon juice. Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Pre-Preparation: Soak Chana/Chole/Garbanzo Beans in water for 8 to 10 hours Boil soaked Chana in pressure cooker by add sufficient water and salt to taste upto 8 whistles Ingredients: Boiled Chana/ Chole/Garbanzo beans - 1 bowl Finely chopped onion - 1 bowl Finely chopped tomatoes üçÖ¬†- 1 bowl Chopped coriander- 1 cup Red chilly Powder - 1 tb sp Dry Mango Powder - 1 tsp Garam Masala - 1 tsp Chole Masala - 1 tb sp Coriander Powder - 1/2 tb sp Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp Salt - to taste Butter - melted - 4 tb sp Lemon juice - 1 tb sp Procedure:
  • Heat pan on medium to high
  • Add Butter/ Ghee
  • Add Green chillies, ginger garlic paste and onion
  • Saute well and cook 1 min
  • Add chopped tomato & saute
  • Close with lid and cook 5 mins
  • Add spices and salt
  • Cook 2 mins by covering with lid
  • Saute and add Boiled Chana
  • Mix well and add 1 cup of water
  • Cook 3 mins by closing with lid
  • Add coriander leaves and lemon juice.
  • Give it a mix and cook 2 mins
  • Chole Masala is ready to serve
  • Famous combination is Bhatura üòã
  • Side dish for breakfast recipe
